engine.util.factory

Class SoundFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.util.factory.SoundFactory

  • public class SoundFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A factory for creating Sounds.
    Author:
    Benny Bobaganoosh (thebennybox@gmail.com)

    • Constructor Detail

      • SoundFactory

        public SoundFactory(IAudioDevice device,
            java.lang.String filePath)
        Creates a new Sound Factory
        Parameters:
        device - The device to generate sounds for.
        filePath - The base path for sound files.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public Sound get(java.lang.String fileName,
        double volume,
        double pitch,
        boolean shouldLoop)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Gets a new object from the factory. If the desired sound data is already loaded, then the sound data is reused and not loaded again. Otherwise, the sound data is loaded from the specified file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of an audio file to be loaded.
        volume - How loud the audio should be played at. 1.0 specifies normal volume, and lower or higher values specify quieter or louder volumes, respectively.
        pitch - What pitch the audio should be played at. 1.0 specifies normal pitch, and lower or higher values specify higher or lower pitches, respectively.
        shouldLoop - Whether the audio should automatically restart when finished playing.
        Returns:
        A Sound matching the specification.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be loaded.
